sub_topic: Applying the Fourier transform to image processing
message_1: A digital image of 512x512 pixels is given. Apply the 2D Fourier Transform to the image and obtain its frequency spectrum. How many distinct frequency components are there in the frequency spectrum?
message_2:
When you apply the 2D Fourier Transform to a digital image of size MxN (in this case, 512x512 pixels), you obtain a frequency spectrum of the same size, MxN. Each element in the frequency spectrum represents a distinct frequency component. Therefore, for a 512x512 image, there are:

512 x 512 = 262,144 distinct frequency components in the frequency spectrum.
